intro: Stachys huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén sedge, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic foliage. This plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats at high altitudes. Its flowers are small and clustered in whorls, often with a distinctive purple or violet coloration. Stachys huillensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude environments.
